intro: Astragalus shehbazii, commonly known as the Kashmir Astragalus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its seed pods are distinctive, often containing numerous small, lens-shaped seeds. Astragalus shehbazii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
